result.execSummary:
All charges against Jeru Richmond in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeru Richmond is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeru Richmond

records.addlTxt: DE to be released as to this case

Attorney Thomas Binger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for Jeru Richmond. Defendant Jeru Richmond in court, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. State moves to dismiss. Court grants. This case is dismissed.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Corcoran. Attorney Corcoran still have some investigations to due. Atty Corcoran is going to file a motion. MH set to 10/19/22 at 2:00. Court finds DE in summary contempt due to this mornings actions on zoom. Court imposes a 30 day sanction immediately. DE will not get credit for these 30 days.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Corcoran.   Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Corcoran stated off the record that he has not received an offer yet and needed a new date. The DE became agitated and started swearing at the court. The Judge gave him warnings but the DE continuted. Judge finds DE in contempt of court and Orderd the DE be brought over in person today 07/28/22 at 2:00 to deal with the contempt of court.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
